tips.text: That's right, 20 beers on tap, including rare brews from their "10-barrel pilot system" that you can't get anywhere else.
After you've tried some cider, don't be afraid to try mixing some together. It's not weird; the staff does it all the time and many combinations are fantastic!
This vast, shiny flagship on Boston’s waterfront is a three-story salute to a local institution.
Best brew I've had since I moved to Boston 2 weeks ago. They're now open till 9 pm!
18 % gratuity added to ALL services. Goes directly to all service personnel. No tipping needed!
best rooftop bar in the city.... hands down!
A great place to grab breakfast or a beer after work. They also have burgers for lunch that seem to be very good. I look forward to trying the burger one day that I am able to get down here
Huge space! A great beer choices and the food menu looks good! Next I have to try their brunch menu
Great selection of bourbon, scotches, and beers!
Not just seafood.  Filet mignon was deeeeelish.
Love the feta cheese with sliced tomato pizza! Nice staff!
Not a bad neighborhood spot. Great for drinks, food could be better
With 3 levels including a fish-market style approach to casual dining, a proper dining room, & a roof-deck with gorgeous views of the water - gives you a variety of ways to enjoy your seafood.
If you love watching old men flirt with prostitutes, you'll really love Empire.
The major is hot bitch. That's what tom meant.
I've been here several times and its a treat!!! Love the meatball appetizer and veal Parmesan!!!
Jambalaya is good. Short rib gnocchi is also very tasty.

formattedAddress: 1 Harborside Dr., Terminal C (Boston Logan Airport)

tips.text: Electrical outlet at every seat at bar. Never had a bad meal at any Legal Seafoods.
If you like shit service by disinterested bitches, this is the spot.

While "waiting to go across," I recommend trying the Bocce Ball (on the "Prima" menu).  Then come back for a Toasted Almond, on the "Dopo" menu ("Prima" means "before," "Dopo" means "after."  Get it?)

formattedAddress: 1 Harborside Dr., Terminal A (at BOS Airport)

tips.text: Get your chowda fix before leaving town!
Try the Captain & Coke drink ...it'll twist your night.

contact.facebookName: Jerry Remys Sports Bar & Grill at Seaport

tips.text: Cheer loudly for both teams to increase the chances that someone will randomly buy you a drink. #DontBlowIt
The best way to navigate the wine menu is by ordering a wine flight!  Try three wines the staff has grouped together and discover the wines you will write home about! Got Questions? Just ask! :)
Quieter than the other bars in Terminal A, which are basically all different versions of the same airport sports bar.
Tuna melt is good!
Decent beer selection and a cool view.
Try the blueberry ale!
Fremch dip is great
Pre-flight IPA is one of the best things ever.
No me comía un calentado así de bueno desde mis días de afterparty en la mayorista ✌
Veggie Burger and Fries were reallly reallly good!
Water yummy
Drinks are relatively cheap for a hotel bar. Bartenders are really friendly and late night menu till midnight. This is my kind of place.
These guys are the best in Chelsea
